answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Hello Sheron, 
ICMA has a number of resources that can provide you with the information you're looking for. 
Last year, a program developed by the City of Olathe and the University of Kansas for Leadership Training was nominated for an ICMA Outstanding Program Award.  
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/304296/Creating_a_Supervisory_Leadership_Training_Program 
The ICMA Bookstore also has several options for you, such as: 
"Effective Supervisory Skill Building Training Course" 
http://bookstore.icma.org/Effective_Supervisory_Skill_Bu_P185C39.cfm 
And "Supervisory Skills for Improving Employee Performance Training Package" 
http://bookstore.icma.org/Supervisory_Skills_for_Improving_Employee_Performance_Training_Package_P706.cfm 
And there are many more materials in the bookstore that can give you this type of information. A couple of good options for types of publications to look through are:
Professional Development & Training http://bookstore.icma.org/Professional_Development_and_Training_C24.cfm
And Group Courses
http://bookstore.icma.org/Group_Courses_C37.cfm?sid=1& 
Finally, here's a list of ICMA Training Resources that are offer a good variety of examples. 
http://bookstore.icma.org/Professional_Development_and_training_W29.cfm 
I hope this helps to answer your question. Please let us know if we can be of more help. 
Max Moline 
Knowledge Network Intern 
ICMA

author: Sheron Hayes
text:
Does anyone have a list of the Best Practice SupervisorsTraining Programs in County 
government?  I would greatly appreciate obtaining the supervisor training materials for each agency, including, course outlines, curricula, performance measurements, power-point presentations, sample participant surveys and outcome analysis'.
Your assistance in obtaining the information or directing me to other resources would be most helpful.
Thank you,

Las Vegas, NV 89155-1757
